snippet: Patria de los Santos and the eight other bystanders hit by police bullets in the Empire State Building shooting last month are tending to their changed lives and bodies.
abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column on Patria de los Santos, one of nine bystanders hit by police bullets in front of the the Empire State Building after a disgruntled former employee shot and killed a former co-worker; Santos, like the rest of the members of this small club of passers-by shot by police, spends much of her time tending to a life forever changed by the event.
lead_paragraph: Patria de los Santos and the eight other bystanders hit by police bullets in the Empire State Building shooting last month are tending to their changed lives and bodies.

headline.seo: A Bullet Wound Heals, Leaving a Deeper Scar
headline.main: The Bullet Didn’t Leave the Only Scar
headline.print_headline: The Bullet Didn’t Leave The Only Scar
